body:
HasMySecretLeaked is a project from GitGuardian that aims to help individual users and organizations verify if their developer secrets have leaked on public GitHub

<!--
 ### Free SaaS Offering Submission

 Thank you for contributing to this list. This list is for **SaaS**
 services that offer a **free tier** to help developers evaluate and
 build something that users can later use and get support for.

 The focus of this list is quite broad but we try to keep things
 limited to that which infrastructure developers, like DevOps Practitioners,
 would find useful.

 This list is the result of more than a thousand people contributing
 to make something useful, we appreciate your efforts.

 ### Code of Conduct

 We are not here to argue with you. If you are argumentative, abusive,
 lie or missrepresent your service or are otherwise anti-social we will
 block you.

 ### Services we do not accept

   * cPanel like PHP + MySQL hosting services.
   * Free dns services that are generic frontends to CloudFlare or similar
   * Services that are verbatim copy pastes of others while adding no value
-->

## Requirements

<!-- This is only for new submissions -->
<!-- Please ensure your submission ticks all of the requirements -->

 * [x] This is Software as a Service not self hosted
 * [x] It has a free tier not just a free trial
 * [x] Pricing information is clearly visible without signup or phone calls
 * [x] The submission mentions what is free
 * [x] The submission is not already present in the list
 * [x] The service has contact details of those running it and a privacy policy

Added seotest.me to the testing section

The 75GB free object storage is no longer offered by Scaleway. Only the 75GB free egress each month remains. I suggest deleting Scaleway from IaaS altogether.

Amazing list, thanks for putting this together. Hope to see our free tier put to good use! 

Cheers from Brazil 🇧🇷 

## Why we built deco.cx

We were frustrated about how hard it is to deploy a modern TS + Tailwind website with a proper visual editor/admin UI for business users. **So many choices to make!** Which framework? Which platform to deploy on? Which headless CMS? Which A/B testing tool? Which monitoring service? How do we wire all of that together? Oh no, there goes the budget again...

That's why we built deco.cx: so that anyone with basic TypeScript and CSS can deploy a fully-functional, enterprise-grade storefront connected to any API as a data source within a few minutes, AND get PageSpeed 90+. 

We're an edge-native frontend platform focused on making ecommerce websites fast. You write TSX + Tailwind, we generate a beautiful visual CMS automatically. We render your app at the edge, which allows for fast *and* personalized sites at scale, so you can use our built-in A/B testing and content segmentation without fear. Built by devs with 10+ years experience scaling global enterprise ecommerce web properties. 

## Requirements

 * [x] This is Software as a Service not self hosted
 * [x] It has a free tier not just a free trial
 * [x] Pricing information is clearly visible without signup or phone calls
 * [x] The submission mentions what is free

 * [x] The service has contact details of those running it and a privacy policy

https://staticman.net/docs/getting-started.html
you need to deploy it yourself using heroku/docker and I didnt see any public instances
```
Step 2. Deploy Staticman
Read through the [Staticman API config values](https://staticman.net/docs/api) and note the config values you wish to use. At a minimum, you must include a way for Staticman to auth with a git provider, as well as an RSA private key. To generate the RSA private key you can use

openssl genrsa
If you need the newline literals (for example when using JSON configs since multiline strings are not permitted) you can use

openssl genrsa | sed '$!s/$/\\n/' | tr -d '\n'
Option 1. Deploy to Heroku
Follow [this link](https://heroku.com/deploy?template=https://github.com/eduardoboucas/staticman/tree/master) to deploy the latest stable Staticman code to Heroku.
You can enter your Staticman API config values as [Heroku config variables](https://devcenter.heroku.com/articles/config-vars).
(Optional) Create a fork of Staticman and set up a Heroku pipeline to deploy from the fork. This will help you to keep your instance up to date with the latest Staticman improvements and bug fixes.


Option 2. Deploy to your own infrastructure
If you prefer to use Docker, check out the [Docker instructions](https://github.com/eduardoboucas/staticman/blob/master/docs/docker.md). Otherwise continue below

Clone [the Staticman repo](https://github.com/eduardoboucas/staticman.git) and ensure node and npm are installed.
Install the dependencies
npm install
Create a new config from the sample
cp config.sample.json config.production.json
Edit the new production config with any values you want, and then start the Staticman server
npm start


Step 3. Create a site configuration file
Staticman will look for a staticman.yml file in the root of the repository, where various configuration parameters will be defined. These configuration values are specific to the site. This means one Staticman instance can be used with many websites and users.

You can use the [sample site config file](https://github.com/eduardoboucas/staticman/blob/master/staticman.sample.yml) as a starting point and check the [available site configuration parameters](https://staticman.net/docs/configuration) for more information.
```

* Moved
  * SauceLabs free for Open Source (https://saucelabs.com/open-source): Moved to https://opensource.saucelabs.com/
  * cloudimage.com (https://cloudimage.com/)
    * https://performance.cloudimage.com/ shows this website is owned by Scaleflex (https://www.scaleflex.com)
    * In https://www.scaleflex.com/pricing, the new registration page is https://www.cloudimage.io/en/registration\
  * GeocodeAPI (https://geocodeapi.io)
    * Redirected to ipstack (https://ipstack.com/)
  * 3Dassets.one (https://www.3dassets.one/): Moved to https://3dassets.one/. SSL only for the root domain.

* Not free anymore
  * Restlet APIShark (https://restlet.com/products/apispark/)
    * Redirected to https://www.talend.com, didn't see APIShark on the page.
    * Talend Cloud (https://www.talend.com) only has a free trial for 14 days.
  * WayScript (https://www.wayscript.com): [Pricing](https://www.wayscript.com/pricing) page locked, no signup button on the home page.

* Unaccessible
  * vspace (https://vvv.space/): 403 Forbidden, [chrome extension](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/vspace-%E2%80%94-free-bookmark-ma/poebjekpobpcmohnkbfkcfimilbeianl) hasn't been updated since October 25, 2021.
  * Similar Words API (https://word-simi.herokuapp.com/): 404 Not Found, Heroku returned "There's nothing here, yet.", possibly using the Free tier.
  * Hookbin (https://hookbin.com/): Timeout, couldn't connect to the server.
  * Krucible (https://usekrucible.com): Cloudflare returned an Origin DNS error, their [GitHub](https://github.com/Krucible) hasn't been updated since Dec 11, 2022.
  * Coin360 (https://api.coin360.com/): [Main page](https://coin360.com/) still works, API refused to connect (port 80/443 not open).
  * SETools.xyz (https://www.setools.xyz/)
    * CNAME record points to `test.setools.xyz.`
    * `test.setools.xyz.` DNS records are empty.
  * Unixtime (https://unixtime.co.za): Domain for sale
  * QR Code Robot (https://qr-code-robot.com): Domain for sale
  * Frontend Zero to One (https://www.fezto.xyz/): Could not resolve host
  * thundra.io/apm (https://www.thundra.io/apm): Could not resolve host
  * JWT Decoder (https://jwt.ssotools.com/): Could not resolve host
  * Issue Embed (https://issueembed.dev/): Could not resolve host
  * gitential.com (https://gitential.com): Could not resolve host
  * easyDB.io (https://easydb.io/): Could not resolve host
  * Sider (https://sider.review): Could not resolve host
  * Cmd (https://cmd.com/): Could not resolve host

Recently, VistaPanel hosts have been removed from the list of providers on Free-for-Dev, raising concerns among developers who have been using this hosting service. This issue aims to address the removal of VistaPanel hosts from the platform and clarify their authenticity as non-fake cPanel hosts.

Background:
VistaPanel is a web hosting control panel that has been providing free hosting services to developers for several years. It offers a user-friendly interface with features similar to cPanel, making it a popular choice among developers, particularly those working on small projects or personal websites.

Issue Details:

Removal of VistaPanel hosts: The sudden removal of VistaPanel hosts from the Free-for-Dev platform has left many developers puzzled and concerned. These hosts have been a reliable option for developers who require basic hosting functionalities without the need for advanced features provided by premium hosting services.

Authenticity concerns: It is important to note that VistaPanel hosts are NOT fake cPanel hosts. While cPanel is a widely recognized and powerful hosting control panel, VistaPanel is a separate, standalone control panel designed to provide a simplified hosting experience. The removal of VistaPanel hosts from Free-for-Dev may have inadvertently given the impression that they were illegitimate or fake.

Value for developers: VistaPanel hosts have been a valuable resource for developers who are just starting out or have limited budgets. They provide an accessible platform for experimenting with web development projects, learning new technologies, and showcasing personal portfolios. Restoring VistaPanel hosts on Free-for-Dev would ensure that developers continue to have access to this free hosting option.

Distinguishing VistaPanel from cPanel: To address any confusion surrounding VistaPanel, it would be helpful to provide a clear distinction between VistaPanel and cPanel hosts on the Free-for-Dev platform. This could include adding a separate category for VistaPanel hosts or clearly labeling them as "VistaPanel" to prevent any misinterpretation.

Proposed Solution:

Restore VistaPanel hosts: We request the Free-for-Dev platform administrators to consider bringing back VistaPanel hosts to the list of available hosting providers. This would allow developers to continue benefiting from the simplicity and accessibility that VistaPanel offers.

Clarify authenticity: To avoid any misunderstandings regarding the legitimacy of VistaPanel hosts, it would be beneficial to include a brief explanation or disclaimer emphasizing that VistaPanel is a distinct hosting control panel and not a fake version of cPanel.

Provide distinction: Consider implementing visual or categorization changes on the Free-for-Dev platform to clearly differentiate between cPanel hosts and VistaPanel hosts. This could involve labeling VistaPanel hosts prominently or providing a separate category or section for them.

By addressing these concerns and taking the proposed actions, Free-for-Dev can continue to provide an inclusive and diverse selection of hosting options for developers, while acknowledging the unique value that VistaPanel hosts bring to the community.

There is a common misconception among some users that VistaPanel hosts are "fake cPanel" hosts. However, this is not an accurate description of VistaPanel hosts and can lead to confusion for users who are not familiar with the differences between the two.

While VistaPanel and cPanel share some similarities in terms of functionality and features, they are fundamentally different platforms with distinct interfaces and design philosophies. VistaPanel is a proprietary web hosting control panel developed by iFastNet, whereas cPanel is a commercial web hosting control panel developed by cPanel, LLC.

One key difference between VistaPanel and cPanel is that VistaPanel is designed specifically for use with MyOwnFreeHost reseller hosting, whereas cPanel is designed to work with a wide variety of hosting platforms. Additionally, VistaPanel offers a streamlined interface and feature set that is tailored to the needs of resellers, whereas cPanel offers a more comprehensive set of features and tools that are suitable for a wider range of hosting scenarios.

Therefore, it is important to clarify that VistaPanel hosts are not "fake cPanel" hosts, but rather a unique and distinct web hosting control panel designed specifically for use with MyOwnFreeHost reseller hosting.

I propose that we update our documentation and marketing materials to reflect this distinction, and to provide users with a clearer understanding of the benefits and features of VistaPanel hosting.

Please feel free to share your thoughts and feedback on this issue, and let's work together to ensure that our users have a clear and accurate understanding of the differences between VistaPanel and cPanel hosting.

Note that this is a completely free & unlimited api (at least with respect to how many schedules one can create). As such, there is no signup required, no login screen, or api-key etc. In other words, the only piece of user-related info the server needs to know is simply an email address (of the job-owner) - no card details, or login credentials are stored anywhere!

snappify helps developers to create stunning visuals. It doesn't matter if you want to create beautiful images of your code snippets or fully fletched technical presentations (like in PowerPoint).

It also allows you to embed or share your creations in an accessible way where the viewer can easily copy the code.

The free tier includes creating up to 3 snaps (but unlimited downloads), provides 5 AI-powered explanations per month, and enables adding styling possibilities like Rich-Text Elements and Profile Info Elements for custom branding.

 Thank you for contributing to this list. This list is for **SaaS**
 services that offer a **free tier** to help developers evaluate and
 build something that users can later use and get support for.

 The focus of this list is quite broad but we try to keep things
 limited to that which infrastructure developers, like DevOps Practitioners,
 would find useful.

 This list is the result of more than a thousand people contributing
 to make something useful, we appreciate your efforts.

 ### Code of Conduct

 We are not here to argue with you. If you are argumentative, abusive,
 lie or missrepresent your service or are otherwise anti-social we will
 block you.

 ### Services we do not accept

   * cPanel like PHP + MySQL hosting services.
   * Free dns services that are generic frontends to CloudFlare or similar
   * Services that are verbatim copy pastes of others while adding no value
-->

## Requirements

<!-- This is only for new submissions -->
<!-- Please ensure your submission ticks all of the requirements -->

 * [x] This is Software as a Service not self hosted
 * [x] It has a free tier not just a free trial
 * [x] The submission mentions what is free
 * [x] The submission is not already present in the list
 * [x] The service has contact details of those running it and a privacy policy

 build something that users can later use and get support for.

 The focus of this list is quite broad but we try to keep things
 limited to that which infrastructure developers, like DevOps Practitioners,
 would find useful.

 This list is the result of more than a thousand people contributing
 to make something useful, we appreciate your efforts.

 ### Code of Conduct

 We are not here to argue with you. If you are argumentative, abusive,
 lie or missrepresent your service or are otherwise anti-social we will
 block you.

 ### Services we do not accept

   * cPanel like PHP + MySQL hosting services.
   * Free dns services that are generic frontends to CloudFlare or similar
   * Services that are verbatim copy pastes of others while adding no value
-->

## Requirements

<!-- This is only for new submissions -->
<!-- Please ensure your submission ticks all of the requirements -->

 * [x] This is Software as a Service not self hosted
 * [x] It has a free tier not just a free trial
 * [x] The submission mentions what is free
 * [x] The submission is not already present in the list
 * [x] The service has contact details of those running it and a privacy policy
